truth: -  "Political economy is a branch of social science that studies production, trade, and their relationship with law, custom, and government."
fiction: -  "Political economy is a branch of culinary arts that studies the production of pastries, their trade, and their relationship with law, custom, and government."

truth: -  "Adam Smith, a Scottish economist and philosopher, is often considered the father of modern political economy."
fiction: -  "Adam Smith, a Scottish magician and illusionist, is often considered the father of modern political economy."

truth: -  "Karl Marx's critique of political economy, outlined in Das Kapital, is a foundational text in the field of Marxist economics."
fiction: -  "Karl Marx's critique of political economy, outlined in Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, is a foundational text in the field of Marxist economics."

truth: -  "The Bretton Woods system was a monetary management system that established the rules for commercial and financial relations among the world's major industrial states in the mid-20th century."
fiction: -  "The Bretton Woods system was a global tree planting initiative that established the rules for commercial and financial relations among the world's major industrial states in the mid-20th century."

truth: -  "The World Bank and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) were both created at an international conference convened in Bretton Woods, New Hampshire, United States in July 1944."
fiction: -  "The World Bank and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) were both created at an international conference convened in Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in July 1944."

truth: -  "Neoliberalism is a policy model of social studies and economics that transfers control of economic factors to the private sector from the public sector."
fiction: -  "Neoliberalism is a policy model of social studies and economics that transfers control of economic factors to the realm of fantasy creatures from the public sector."

truth: -  "The Great Depression was a severe worldwide economic depression that took place during the 1930s."
fiction: -  "The Great Depression was a worldwide dance competition that took place during the 1930s."

truth: -  "The term 'political economy' was used for the first time around the 18th century."
fiction: -  "The term 'political economy' was used for the first time around the Jurassic period."

truth: -  "The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is an agreement signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, creating a trilateral trade bloc in North America."
fiction: -  "The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is an agreement signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, creating a trilateral superhero alliance in North America."

truth: -  "Protectionism is the economic policy of restricting imports from other countries through methods such as tariffs on imported goods, import quotas, and a variety of other government regulations."
fiction: -  "Protectionism is the economic policy of restricting imports from other countries through methods such as magical barriers, import dragons, and a variety of other mythical regulations."

truth: -  "Fiscal policy refers to the use of government revenue collection and expenditure to influence a country's economy."
fiction: -  "Fiscal policy refers to the use of government's collection of unicorn horns and expenditure to influence a country's economy."

truth: -  "The World Trade Organization (WTO) is an intergovernmental organization that regulates international trade."
fiction: -  "The World Trade Organization (WTO) is an intergalactic organization that regulates interstellar trade."

truth: -  "Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services is rising, and subsequently, purchasing power is falling."
fiction: -  "Inflation is the rate at which balloons for goods and services are rising, and subsequently, helium supply is falling."

truth: -  "A mixed economy is an economic system combining private and public enterprise."
fiction: -  "A mixed economy is an economic system combining human and alien enterprise."

truth: -  "The gold standard is a monetary system where a country's currency or paper money has a value directly linked to gold."
fiction: -  "The gold standard is a monetary system where a country's currency or paper money has a value directly linked to chocolate."

truth: -  "Austerity measures refer to official actions taken by the government, during a period of adverse economic conditions, to reduce its budget deficit."
fiction: -  "Austerity measures refer to official actions taken by the government, during a period of zombie apocalypse, to reduce its budget deficit."
